subject: Marketing
title: The Zero Moment of Truth
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: The Zero Moment of Truth.

hook.text: Google discovered that buyers research online before ever touching a product in a store.

buildup.text: They called it the Zero Moment of Truthâ€”the research phase between stimulus and shelf.

discovery.text: Today's buyer reads 10+ sources before a purchase. The decision is made before the store visit.

twist.text: Brands that lose the zero moment lose the sale, even if their product is better on the shelf.

climax.text: Winning ZMOT means owning search results, reviews, and comparison content.

punchline.text: The sale starts on the search bar, not the shelf.

quiz.question: What is the Zero Moment of Truth?
options: The online research phase before a purchase decision
The exact moment a customer enters a store
The first time a customer sees a television ad
